title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1200.8.2 - Judicial officers and candidates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1200.8.2 - Judicial officers and candidates

State Regulations
(a) A lawyer shall not knowingly make a
false statement of fact concerning the qualifications, conduct or integrity of
a judge or other adjudicatory officer or of a candidate for election or
appointment to judicial office. (b) A lawyer who is a candidate for
judicial office shall comply with the applicable provisions of Part 100 of the

Rules of the Chief Administrator of the Courts. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1200.8.2. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
